summary: The interests of financial professionals and retirement investors often conflict. For example, a financial professional may earn a commission from selling a product to a client—whether it makes money for the client or not. We reviewed how such conflicts are communicated, their link to returns, and more. Our review of 2,000 conflict disclosures and our calls posing as potential clients to 75 financial professionals found...
title: Retirement Investments: Agencies Can Better Oversee Conflicts of Interest Between Fiduciaries and Investors
